titles.title: Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” / Mälkǝʾa sänbätä krǝstiyan “Image of the Sabbath of Christians”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (fols. 3ra–41ra l.3) II) Mälkǝʾa sänbätä krǝstiyan “Image of the Sabbath of Christians ” (fols. 41ra l.4-46va l.13)
Additiones 1-3.

copyists.copyist: The scribe is possibly Ḫaylä Śәllase Hagwäs of Qäqäma (Tämben, QDGM), who is indicated as the seller in Additio 2.

donors.donor: Various individuals are mentioned in the supplication formulas: Wälättä Krәstos (fols. 3ra, 41ra); Kidanä Maryam (fols. 41ra, 47vb); Wälättä Ṣadǝqan (fols. 46va, 47vb); Wälättä Maryam (fols. 46va, 47vb); Wälättä Kidan (fols. 46va, 47vb); Wälättä Giyorgis (fol. 46va l.18).

dcomments.dcomment: According to Additio 2, the Ms. was bought and donated in 1971 A.M. (= 1978/79 A.D.)

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations;

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 3 tools were used: single line fillet, triple sine, cross hatching).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

inks.ink: Black; red and reddish-brown (s. other details).

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(8/fols. 11r-13v) – ፫III(8/fols. 14r-26v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – ፭V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(6/fols. 43r-48v) – B(2/fols. 49r-50v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 46r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: very crude. Hand b: mediocre but regular

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: Hand b (fols. 4va–vb, 8va–9rb, 10ra, 19vb, 21rab): somewhat better in quality, conspicuously right sloping.

otherdetails.otherdetail: Reddish-brown ink in fols.: 41ra, l.3; 46va, ls. 16-18 (in Additio I); 47va, l.6 - 48ra, l.8 (throughout Additio II).

desccontent.text: I. Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jaqob of Serug)
desccontent.mss:
BN d´Abbadie 247 (19th cent.), fols. 80r-92v: “Sermon de Jacques de Saroug sur le dimanche” (ChAbb 139). EMML no. 378 (1959/70), fols. 1r-23v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 93; Church of St. Gabriel, quarter of Mäkkakäläña, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 400 (late 19th cent.), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 116; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 624 (1908), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 372; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 885 (1916/30), fols. 3r-19r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML III, 210; Church of Qwǝsqwam, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1672 (20th cent.), fols. 1r-66r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 148; Private library of Mämhǝr Gäbrä Mäsqäl Täsfaye, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 4017 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 122r-147v: “Homily by James of Sarug on the Christian Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML X, 9; Church of Mäsḉa Maryam, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4362 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-15r: “Homily on the (Christian) Sabbath [Dersāna Sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 125; Church of ʾƎllägänd Mikaʾel, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa).
-------------------------------------------------------- The Mss. containing only "Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan" without "Mälkǝʾa sänbätä krǝstiyan":
EMML no. 1512 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-4v, 71rv, 100v-107r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 12; Institute of Ethiopian Studies, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1589 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-30v: “Dersāna sanbat, attributed to James of Sarug” (EMML V, 77; Private library of Dr. Abraham Demoz, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1656 (19th cent.), fols. 2r-22v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 141; Church of Dämṭa Giyorgis, Gubalafto, Wällo). EMML no. 2190 (1179/1800), fols. 124r-137v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 302; Church of Miṭaq ʾAmanuʾel, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2323 (1923/24), fols. 3r-27r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 372; Church of ʾƎlqo Mädḫane ʿAläm, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2392 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 222r-228r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 463; Church of Miṭaq Täklä Haymanot, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2726 (1775-1809), fols. 4r-5r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML VII, 117; Church of Ḥarr ʾAmba Yoḥannәs, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 3200 (17th cent.), fols. 2r-4v, 5r-6v, 15rv, 17rv, 18rv, 20r-21r, 22r-23v: “Homily on the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat] ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML VIII, 150; Church of Sarya Mikaʾel, Zanǧira, Wärana Basso, Shoa). EMML no. 3341 (1755/69, 1769/96), fols. 48v-63v: “Homily of James of Sarug about Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 215; Church of Gädam Maryam, ʾAsagәrt, Shoa). EMML no. 3472 (18th cent.), fols. 146rv, 135r-145v, 147r-149v: “Homily of James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 286; Church of Gubbalafto Täklä Haymanot, Yäǧǧu, Wällo). EMML no. 3965 (20th cent.), fols. 2r-3v: “Homily by James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML IX, 256; Church of Laǧǧa Gәnd Giyorgis, Wärana Baso, Shoa). EMML no. 4435 (1891), fols. 182r-186r: “Homily on Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 152; Church of Sälla Dәnqay Marqos, Moǧa and Wädärra, Shoa). Orient. 18, fols. 121r-138v: “Homilia Jacobi Sarugensis de Sabbatho” (DillmLond 22). StrRyMan 7 (17th/18th cent.), fols. 44v-49r: “Sermon of Jacob of Serug” (StrJRyM 14). StrANL Conti Rossini 71 (19th/20th cent.), fols. 62r-64v: “Sermon de Jacques de Seroug” (StrANL 188). TelAviv, Library Faitllovitch, 34 (18th cent.), fols. 1-28 (cp. M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 344).

edition.text: ድርሳነ፡ ሰንበት፡ (Dǝrsanä sänbät, ‘Homily of the Sabbathʼ), ed. by ʾabba GÄBRÄ KIDAN BÄZZABBƎH – ʾaggafari GÄBRÄ IYÄSUS – MÄŠÄŠA GƎZZAW; Addis Abäba 1947 A.M. [1954/55 A.D.]; ibid. ed. by TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚƎLLASE, Addis Abäba 1959 A.M. [1966/67 A.D.]. M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 343-61.

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 3ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ድርሳን፡ ዘሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቅድስት፡ ዘደረሰ፡ አባ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘስሩግ፡ ርቱአነ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረአቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምለአመቱ[sic]፡ ወለተ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ [n.l.] ለአለመ፡ አ፡ ስምዑ። ፍቁራንየ፡ ውሉዳ፡ ቤ[fol. 3rb]ተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በዕንተ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ …
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. (This is) the homily which ˀabba Jaqob of Serug, Orthodox in faith, composed on St. Sabbath of Christians. May his prayer be with his maid Wälättä Krәstos for the eternity. Listen, my beloved ones, sons of the church, about her greatness and her glory …
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 40vb; l.7: … and receive the Eucharist and the sacrifice ?? in the justice with all children, forever and ever. Amen. The one who made write this book (are) Wälättä Krәstos, Kidanä Maryam?

desccontent.text: II. Mälkǝʾa sänbätä krǝstiyan “Image of the Sabbath of Christians"
desccontent.mss:
BN d´Abbadie 247 (19th cent.), fols. 93r-96r: “Salām sur le dimanche” (ChAbb 139). EMML no. 378 (1959/70), fols. 29r-34v: “‘Image’ of Sunday [Malkeʾa sanbata krestiyān]” (EMML II, 93; Church of St. Gabriel, quarter of Mäkkakäläña, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 400 (late 19th cent.), fols. 47r-53r: “‘Image’ of the Christian Sabbath [Malkeʾa sanbata krestiyān]” (EMML II, 116; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 624 (1908), fols. 27r-29v: “‘Image’ of Sunday [Malkeʾa sanbata]” (EMML II, 372; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 885 (1916/30), fols. 1v-2v: “‘Image’ of Sunday [Malkeʾa sanbata krestiyān]” (EMML III, 210; Church of Qwǝsqwam, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1672 (20th cent.), fols. 66r-74r: “Malkeʾa sanbata krestiyān” (EMML V, 148; Private library of Mämhǝr Gäbrä Mäsqäl Täsfaye, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 4017 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 121v, 148r-149r: “Image of Sunday [Malkeʾa Sanbata krestiyān]” (EMML X, 9; Church of Mäsḉa Maryam, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4362 (19th cent.), fols. 15r-16r: “Greeting [Salām] to the Christian Sabbath” (EMML X, 125; Church of ʾƎllägänd Mikaʾel, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa).
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The Mss. containing only "Mälkǝʾa sänbätä krǝstiyan" without "Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan":
EMML no. 1494 (20th cent.), fols. 2r-5r: “Image of Sunday [Malkeʾa sanbata krestiyān]” (EMML IV, 626; Institute of Ethiopian Studies, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 2097 (1817), fol. 183r: “Image of Sunday [Malkeʾa Sanbata krestiyān]” (EMML VI, 189; Church of Miṭaq Täklä Haymanot, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2706 (18th cent.), fols. 155r-156r: “Image [malkeʾ] of Sunday” (EMML VII, 107; Church of Tač Dänn Kidana Mǝrät, Ḥarr ʾAmba, Shoa). EMML no. 2799 (17th/18th cent.), fols. 83r-84v: “Malkeʾa Sanbata krestiyān” (EMML VII, 141; Library of Dässaläññ Taddäsa, Monastery of Ḥayq ʾƎsṭifanos, ʾAmbassal, Wällo). EMML no. 2845 (late 18th cent.), fols. 1r-2v: “Malkeʾa Sanbata krestiyān” (EMML VII, 191; Church of Mäśaqo, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2947 (1881/1926), fols. 92v-95v: “Malkeʾa Sanbata krestiyān” (EMML VII, 254; Church of Geǧǧa Maryam, Säbbäta, Shoa). EMML no. 2986 (19th cent.), fols. 75r-76v: “Malkeʾa Sanbata krestiyān” (EMML VII, 289; Church of Mäskwa Maryam, Gubbalafto, Wällo). EMML no. 3022 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-2v: “Image [Malkeʾ] of Sunday” (EMML VIII, 24; Church of Ḥarr Mikaʾel, Ḥarr ʾAmba, Shoa). EMML no. 4086 (19th cent.), fols. 92v-94v: “Image of Sunday Sabbath [Malkeʾa Sanbata krestiyān]” (EMML X, 40; Church of Wärämo Mikaʾel, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa).
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 41ra: Salutation to the recollection of your name, the name of the wonder and astonishment; and salutation to the hairs of your head which the light of the divinity covers. St. Sabbath of Christians, repose of the sinners…
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 46rb, l.18: …ሰንበተ፡ ክ[fol. 46va]ርስቲያን፡ ሐብኒ፡ ፍትሐ፡ ሣህልኢ።[sic]፡ኪ ለለዕቱ: ከመ፡ ይንሣዕ፡ አሥበ። ፃማሁ። ነጋዲ። ዝንቱ፡ አስበ፡ ድርሳንየ፡ ኢይጥፋዕ፡ በከንቱ። ለዓለመ። አለም። አሜን። ለይኩን። ለይኩን፨፨
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 46rb: ... Sabbath of Christians, give me the justice of your  compassion for every day, so that that traveller would receive reward  for his toils, and the reward of my homily would not perish in vain.  Forever and ever. Amen. So be it, so be it.

additional.cont: Fols. 46va: Names of the donors.
additional.det: Written in red, in the same hand as Additio 3.

additional.cont: Fols. 46vb–47vb: Prayer or supplication of the scribe.
additional.det: Very crudely written in the main hand.

additional.cont: Fols. 47vb l.6–48va l.8: Donation note.
additional.add: Fol. 47vb l.6: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ {ዘወይዘሮ፡ ብሩር}፡ ዘወሀበቶ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ፍሬ፡ ማለ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩና፡ መርሐ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ስመ፡ አቡሃ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወስመ፡ እማ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወለተ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለተ፡ ኪዳን፡ ወለተ፡ ኪዳን፡ ለዚሁ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ የተገዛበት፡ ሚያዝያ፡ ፮ቀን፡ ፸፩፡ ዓ፡ ም፡ [fol. 48ra] ዋጋው፡ ፳፭ብር፡ ነው፡ ለዚሁ፡ ሻጭ፡ ኃይለ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ሃጐስ፡ አገር፡ ተምቤን፡ ጐጥ፡ ቀቀማ፡ ለዝ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ይኩን፡
additional.tran: Fol. 47vb l.6: This book is of wäyzäro Bәrur who donated it to the tabot of Giyorgis Fәre Malä so that it might be her guide for the Kingdom of Heaven. The name of her father (is) Kidanä Maryam and the name of her mother (is) Wälättä Ṣadәqan Wälättä Maryam Wälättä Kidan Wälättä Kidan. This book was bought on 6 Miyazya 71 year of mercy, its price is 25 Bәrr. The seller of the book is Ḫaylä Śәllase Hagwäs, the country of Tämben, gwäṭ Qäqäma. May the one who stole and scraped the book be anathematized in the dominion of Peter and Paul.
additional.det: Written in red, in a secondary hand.

frames.frame: Crude ornamental band composed from two chains of black and red dots with red down-pointing chevrons in between: fols. 46va, ls. 14-15, 47vb, ls. 5-6.
